statement.p: Explain why the vectors \left[\begin{array}{r} -3 \\ 0 \\ -2 \\ 5 \\ 3 \end{array}\right] , \left[\begin{array}{r} 2 \\ -5 \\ -5 \\ -6 \\ 5 \end{array}\right] , \left[\begin{array}{r} 0 \\ 2 \\ 5 \\ -1 \\ 2 \end{array}\right] , \left[\begin{array}{r} -3 \\ 1 \\ 0 \\ -2 \\ -4 \end{array}\right] , \text{ and } \left[\begin{array}{r} -2 \\ 0 \\ -6 \\ -1 \\ 3 \end{array}\right] are linearly dependent or linearly independent.

answer.p: The vectors \left[\begin{array}{r} -3 \\ 0 \\ -2 \\ 5 \\ 3 \end{array}\right] , \left[\begin{array}{r} 2 \\ -5 \\ -5 \\ -6 \\ 5 \end{array}\right] , \left[\begin{array}{r} 0 \\ 2 \\ 5 \\ -1 \\ 2 \end{array}\right] , \left[\begin{array}{r} -3 \\ 1 \\ 0 \\ -2 \\ -4 \end{array}\right] , \text{ and } \left[\begin{array}{r} -2 \\ 0 \\ -6 \\ -1 \\ 3 \end{array}\right] are linearly independent .
